DataElement.preferredName: Primary Neoplasm Bone Shortest Dimension Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the length of the shortest dimension/diameter of a tumor at the original site of origin in centimeters(cm).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the final result of an original tumor with connective tissue that forms the skeletal components.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original. (American Heritage Dictionary):(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The structural organ comprised of specialized connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
